Increased economic opportunities: A universal language would make it easier for businesses to operate on a global scale, as they could easily communicate with customers and partners in different countries.
Simplified education: A universal language would make it easier for students to learn new subjects and access educational resources from around the world.
Easier international travel: A universal language would make it easier for people to travel abroad, as they would be able to communicate with locals without language barriers.
Reduced misunderstandings: A universal language would reduce misunderstandings that can arise from language barriers, leading to fewer conflicts and misunderstandings.
Increased cultural exchange: A universal language would make it easier for people to learn about and appreciate different cultures, leading to increased cultural exchange and understanding.
